clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of Perfusion Index in Children
clinical_study.official_title: The Role of Peripheral Perfusion Index in Evaluating the Success of Peripheral Nerve Block in Children Under Sedation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of our study is to test the usability of the perfusion index in evaluating the success of the peripheral nerve block applied under sedation in children.

primary_outcome.description: To test the objective role of perfusion index in assessing the success of the peripheral nerve block in children under sedation.

intervention.description: To test the objective role of perfusion index in assessing the success of the peripheral nerve block in children under sedation.

study_pop.textblock: 60 patients with ASA 1 between the ages 2-8 who will undergo elective upper extremity surgery will be included in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- will undergo elective upper limb surgery,
- 2-8 years old,
- ASA I
Exclusion Criteria:
- have regional anesthesia contraindications,
- allergic to local anesthetics,
- having an infection at the injection site
- patients who do not accept the procedure
